rComments: Always showed up late. Unclear expectations and grades did not reflect her comments made in person. Most frustrating was getting positive feedback in class but watching her nod along with guest reviewers who ripped apart your work for focusing on subject matter that she pushed you towards .
great prof. excellent feedback. explains things clearly and helps push your work to the best. very persistent and passionate about material she's teaching.

The problem with Manar wasnt that she set high expectations. Ive had profs that had higher expectations than manar, the difference between manar and those profs was that they would guide you in order to reach their expectations. Manar simply humiliated students without guided criticism and perceived that as setting the bar high

Objectively, Manar is hard-working, persistent and dedicated to challenging students so they have projects that are well resolved by going through phases of design iterations and proposals. I was able to defend my final project during my final crit because Id previously gone through several weeks of criticism and feedback with Manar.

5- Shes got great ideas and is super well informed. She sets really high expectations, and if you find that that attitude motivates you to work harder, then Manar is great. Every student knows the load of their own schedule and the kind of instructor-attitude that helps them be productive, so its all about finding an instructor you'll click with.

3- As an instructor, she did put a lot of pressure on us and asked us for a lot, but from what I understood from being in the class was that the intention behind that was to try to get us to challenge ourselves and produce drawings and models that had clear design intentions and were well thought out.

The course content was great; this course will really help you up your portfolio. However, Manar was a big let down. She did not provide the guidance or mentorship required for this high-level studio. If I could redo my final studio, I would choose my professor much more wisely.

I didn't receive the guidance I was expecting for such a small class. We were told to figure out how to render three days before the final critique, but no one ever taught us except for the TA who was somewhat helpful. The prof doesn't have strong mentorship skills unfortunately.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader', 'Participation matters']

rComments: The syllabus for this course was super interesting but unfortunately the professor really made things difficult. I really wanted to get an A in my last undergraduate studio but it was difficult to keep up with the professors demands.
teacherRatingTags: ['Group projects', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: ARC361 is already a hard course as it is, since its a double credit. Taking the course with manar only multiplied the difficulty of the course. I would recommend taking this course with another prof if available. Manar is a little disorganized and her feedback is not something that will help progress your work.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Wouldnt recommend. Its really hard to keep up with her feedback, because the grades she gives are not consistent with her feedback.
Manar was very dedicated and motivating. I wouldn't have pulled off this project for my folio if it weren't for her encouragement and support and valuable comments on my work.

This class was one of the highlights of my time at school. Manar's high expectations set the bar high and made us work together and help each other in a positive studio environment. I'm very proud of my achievements for the course.

Manar was one of the most attentive teachers i have had. Takes time to give feedback and helped me think through my ideas and develop them for the better. She is dedicated, inspiring and persistent. If it were not for her pushing me I would not have had one of the best projects in my portfolio. She is fair and always tries to be available.

Difficult to deal with, feedback was far from being constructive, passive aggressive, compares you to other students, arbitrary grading scheme, unapproachable, not available outside of class, or in class for that matter, incredibly disorganized: didnt follow the syllabus, desk crits became pin ups, sent email of requirements an hour before class.
